intro: Galium × querceticola, commonly known as the oakleaf wood-remedies, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that resemble those of oak trees, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry berries that contain several seeds. Galium × querceticola is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
